website_summaries.verdict: Well thought-out configuration makes installing components a breeze despite this case’s compact size.
pros: Great ventilation thanks to mesh panels
Side and top panels are easy to remove
Fits longer graphics and PSU cards, with motherboard placed high and out of the way
cons: Power button sits too close to the USB ports

customer_reviews.title: Broken Fan and Front Panel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case, because it was an Amazon Recommended choice. However, when I received the case, one of the fans wasn't working (bottom one), and when I removed the safety film off the front panel, there was a large crack in the middle of it. The material the case is made out of is very flimsy. Would not recommend. Amazon support did a great job in providing compensation for the damage though.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kim

customer_reviews.title: Bad case
customer_reviews.text: Very bad airflow when case is close turns my rtx 2070 very hot when close the case when case is open the video card runs cold
customer_reviews.author: JBM

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts!!!  :(
customer_reviews.text: Came missing HDD tray. Due to the design of the case, this means there is NO way to secure a HDD in place; this creates stability issues with the disk platters, as well as cooling issues, as the HDD cannot be optimally placed as designed. Missing part essentially renders case unusable, or at the level of a used Optiplex case, at best. *EXTREMELY* disappointed w/ this purchase, as I buy specific manufacturers and shipping merchants, and expect a certain level of quality in return. ONE STAR.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best Micro ATX case!
customer_reviews.text: This case is incredible. For the price, it’s easy to get your machine built and running. It’s VERY flexible for different types of configurations, and you won’t find too many coolers that won’t fit with this size. It’s compact without being cramped. It’s literally the perfect size for a “cube” design. I couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: I really like this case!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't built a PC in some time and this was not the easiest build to attempt but after 30 mins of working things out everything came together nicely. Defiantly me, not the case! It's easy to work on and quiet. The only reason I have given it 4 stars under 'easy to remove' is because of the power supplies location. I'm probably being a bit harsh but its a tight fit and I wouldn't want to remove it without stripping the rest of the hardware out first. It has some nice features like foam over intake fan points - just little touches. If I could think of anything remotely negative to say, it's a bit larger than I'd imagined.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: Worst Mini-Fridge Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I tried to put my 6 of Pabst Blue Ribbon in it, but I could not open the dang glass door! This is a very nifty HTPC case. You can put it together all manner of ways, and it shows all the glowy lights from the video card and other blinky components through the clear glass panel, which we put on the top. We put it all together within minutes of the delivery guy handing us the box, and it was up and running games like a shot! It's unfortunate that it has no optical drive bay, but most people are too good and uppity for optical drives in the new age of super-streaming anyway. Simple symmetry. Fear cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Weir

customer_reviews.title: Great box for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's an entry level RGB PC case with tempered glass. It looks great and I had no problem fitting my PC build in it. There is space for everything and everything fits in its place. If you want an inexpensive value case, this is a great choice. One thing I do not like is that the LED light for the power indicator blinks when the PC is in sleep more or powered down. That's stoopid and I've not taken time to figure out how to disable the light electronically and I don't want to unplug it. For now, I just cover it up with something.
customer_reviews.author: KLH

customer_reviews.title: Looks fantastic in the living room and is priced amazingly
customer_reviews.text: I used this case for my home theater PC setup. Looks fantastic in the living room and is priced amazingly. For such a small case, there is tons of room for cable management. The 200mm fan they pre-install works great for keeping everything cool! One thing worth mentioning: in the product description they say "internal Bay: 2x 3.5", 2x 2.5" ...This is a little misleading because you can only install 2 drives in this case, not 4. They are simply made in a way that will allow for either 3.5" or 2.5". Still an outstanding case though.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Belesky

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE airflow
customer_reviews.text: Looks cool, noisy as heck, airflow is horrible. This thing has caused my system to overheat so many times it is smelling like burned plastic now... the fans on the front serve absolutely zero purpose other than to look fancy. My old case that someone had put their foot through had better airflow than this hunk of junk. Came in good condition. Instruction guide was so plain that if it just gave you the common sense things and didn't explain details needed about the case itself or even cover the features unique to the case.
customer_reviews.author: None of your business

customer_reviews.title: The Case Came Scratched, but Still Looks Great
customer_reviews.text: There was a scratch on the front panel of my case, but it's really not that noticeable. I do like the size of the case and it stays clean with the air intake coming in from the side. My components stay cool no matter the load being thrown at it so I really like that as well. The case just looks modern, and I've gotten tons of compliments from gamers and business users alike. I had no issues with cord management and the quality felt about right for the price. Big fan of Thermaltake for this build, haven't had any issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Zadees

customer_reviews.title: Easiest build yet.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe one of the quickest easiest budget builds I’ve done. Not the best for cable management, but overall, extremely happy. Did a cheap build for dad with an Rx580 and a 1700X I had laying around and the b450m. Looks great, I can’t speak for water cooling since AMD makes a wonderful air cooler (the nice one with the heat pipes) I would build in this again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: BigTuna

customer_reviews.title: TINY!
customer_reviews.text: This is about the smallest case I could imagine for a full size GFX card and PSU. I have an 850w PSU and GF2060 in this thing with enough room to spare to mount cooling reservoirs if I decide to go that route. but that's it. It's about MAYBE 12"x12"x12" its basically a perfect cube and all of the sides can be moved to any other side. (front I/O panel is the only thing that cant be moved without mods... which I have already done before even loading an OS in this new build.) If you're tired of Monster Tower builds, check this out. mITX only. everything else is basically free game.
customer_reviews.author: turbogeek

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Mini - ITX Case.
customer_reviews.text: I must say this is the best case I have ever utilized. I replaced my Cooler Master RC-130-KKN1 Elite 130 with this one and it is superior in every way. I love how the PS is underneath and out of the way. Superb cooling. The only very, very minor observation is that you can't move the power switch to the other side. Other than that, it is fantastic. Cable management was a piece of cake. Being able to remove all side is phenomenal.for ease of access and assembly. Great case. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Veridicus

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: I give this four stars in the context of this being more on the cheap side of cases. You get what you pay for!! The metal is pretty flimsy. Not good steel. This is obvious when you have to break off the pci slot covers. The metal bends there very easily. My only real complaint after that is that with mechanical hard drives there is NO sound isolation. There is some sort of rubber pieces where it attaches but they are obviously insufficient. Otherwise- once together its beautiful and the included fans are quiet.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sankey

customer_reviews.title: A lot of room and everything is accessible.
customer_reviews.text: My review is based on the cost of this versus the quality. Very cool operation with an I9. Arctic cooler had plenty of room. The case has excellent ventilation with the huge fan in front. Personally like the design and style very much and have had excellent experiences with their cases. With all 4 sides able to be removed to work on you have a choice for some may leave it an open frame design. Very cost effective if the size is not too much for you. Only thing that surprised me was just 1 1/2" wider would have been perfect for ATX also.
customer_reviews.author: EcoActive

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT case!
customer_reviews.text: This is a super case, especially for the price! It is very well constructed and very well thought out. I was impressed by the quality of the material and the thought that went into the design! You have a lot of options as to how you can build your PC with this case! It also came with all of the screws you could need plus lots of zip ties...everything you need!
customer_reviews.author: witwolf

customer_reviews.title: looks awesome
customer_reviews.text: pros fits everything really nicely plenty of cable management quiet fans cons the only cons i find so far is the lack of air flow. it has a terrible intake found my PC was getting warm so i check the fans on front barely felt air flow so i went ahead an looked at how to remove the smoked front cover. by removing front cover i noticed a night and day difference in air flow im going to try and fab up a new front cover that allows air in but still filters it. honestly i loved the smoked look but we need functionality as well.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Recznik

customer_reviews.title: Excellent SFF PC case
customer_reviews.text: Overall the Core V1 is an excellent, time tested small form factor PC case. The ability to remove the panels down to the skeleton of the case adds ease to building. The only downsides so far is that the acrylic window on the top panel is easily scratched. Light dusting with a micro fabric cloth has produced swirl marks. I plan on replacing this window.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mini-itx case with one flaw...
customer_reviews.text: This is a FANTASTIC mini-ITX case with one fairly large flaw - instead of normal screw-in posts, the motherboard mounts to raised tabs punched out of the metal. They're unfortunately large enough that some motherboard won't go in without removing the metal shield on the back. Aside from that flaw, it's an excellent case. Both side, top, bottom, AND front panels can be removed for assembly/maintenance. And there's a cut-out in the front that allows for really long video cards (I put both a 1080 TI and a 2080 Super in there without issues)
customer_reviews.author: Ignus Fast

customer_reviews.title: A big beautiful monster of a case.
customer_reviews.text: This tower is huge but amazing for customizing a monster rig. I was able to get my entire rig together from hardware installation to OS finalization/customization in one shot. This case made the whole process that much easier. The fans are noisy but expected with the amount of airflow you’re getting in this guy. The fan speeds can be adjusted via 3rd party app or even the bios.
customer_reviews.author: Sevan T.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why the hate for this case. It is the easiest case I have ever built a computer in. All three sides come off making the access super easy. Highly recommended this computer case.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kopas

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: The fans are surprisingly quiet. Easy access to install the mb and power supply. Routing all the data and power cables took a little bit of trial and error to get that clean look but overall it was a snap to get working. The rgb lights came right on and function great. The blue power led on the top of the case is blinding but a little dimmer tape fixed that. I would like to see a more convenient way to mount the side Plexi glass cover. 4 screws every time removal/install occurs gets monotinous. Maybe some type of clip mount instead, with just one screw?
customer_reviews.author: this game is soooooo awsome. love the way they have the players real first name!!!!!

customer_reviews.title: It's a box
customer_reviews.text: Came with a lot of hardware, perfect and plentiful. I recommend you plan out how your gpu and other cards will be set up on the Momo, as parts of the back of the tower must be physically removed with pliers before installing the motherboard. Color of the fans isn't programmable, and they don't come in orange unless set to RGB. Should also note its power button has an obnoxiously bright light that will always be blue and flashing red. It projects a circle on the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob H.

customer_reviews.title: EPIC BUY!
customer_reviews.text: If your looking to build only a Gaming PC and need less space then this Micro ATX Cube Computer Chassis is the best way to go. Easy to use, can pull apart a lot of the components out for easy access to put your mouther board and everything in it. One of the best part of this is that you can switch the Left,Right and top Panels. If your going to use a custome water cooler then i would buy 2 Thermaltake Core V21. You can Hook up the 2nd one on top and hook them togather. "Recommend placing a Liquid CPU Cooler inside" "Recommend Fully Modular Power Supply" - Use only the cables you need.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: split a mid tower in half and make double wide
customer_reviews.text: footprint was a big larger than expected but i'm glad i went larger this time but my old mini itx was just too crunched for comfort. Currently running a mini itx ryzen 2700x build, but I'm also looking at a few micro atx boards since it seems feasible to get double M.2 slots on that platform. In comparison to the Corsair 250D 11Hx11Wx13L it is 13Hx12.5Wx16L. The height and length (deepness) do make a big diff. It has removable dust filters. I recommend that you buy an exhaust fan but there is a change it can butt up against or interfere with the cpu fan so keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: Deceptively large and easy to work in plus great airflow
customer_reviews.text: Case has plenty of room for many full size components, including AIOs, tower air coolers, full sized PSUs, 2-fan GPUs, etc. Cable management, though needing some planning, is easy enough for a tidy build. Airflow is great - the 200mm fan at the front is good for an pre-included fan, and adding the recommended pair of 80mm fans at the back makes a big difference. I do wish the acrylic panel was more acrylic and less metal but that's purely an aesthetic choice. I am very satisfied and the price is stellar.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price... Larger than you think
customer_reviews.text: This case (V21 cube) is super flexible with decent design and quality, especially for the money. You can put the panels on any side you want. All the panels come off including the bottom. Extremely easy to work on. It's bigger than it looks which can be both a positive or a negative. The size makes it easier to work on and everything is much less cramped, but if you are looking for the smallest possible mATX case this is not it. Over all extremely pleased the the case and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: John Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great but annoying power/hdd indicator lights
customer_reviews.text: Nice case. Well designed, easy to assemble, everything works properly. My one complaint is that the power and hard drive indicator lights could summon Batman. I'm not a huge fan of RGB and I keep the lights off or on one of the lighter colors. I like being able to turn that off. The power lights will light up a room at night and I mean an entire living room and it is sort of distracting when watching a movie. I suppose if you like your RGB lights on all the time then your indicator lights aren't too much of a bother.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality control
customer_reviews.text: What a joke. Quality checks at Thermaltake must be few and far between. My unit arrived with a huge dent where the power supply mounts that made it impossible to mount. The entire case is a paperweight at this point. My shipping and item box were in mint condition so it had nothing to do with shipping. Thermaltake sent me an overpriced, damaged, and unusable product.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Page

customer_reviews.title: PCI slots OMG
customer_reviews.text: I had to youtube this case. I thought my PCI slots were broken but nope... You have to break off the metal PCI slots. Why do they not each have a screw? Why does the very top one have a screw, and the rest don't.. which is pointless because the first one is not even lined up with the first PCI slot on my mobo (which may vary per mobo) .... BUT STILL, this is the first and only case that i've ever experienced such a huge headache. WHY WHY WHY did i buy this case ./facepalm
customer_reviews.author: PlAyEd-YoU

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build in
customer_reviews.text: This was a very nice case to build in. I wanted mini itx but it was my first time building in this form factor. I didn't want to run the chance of picking a part that didn't fit (ram not clearing). But my ultimate goal was to have something much smaller than a full size tower that would fit on my desk. I got what I wanted. All the side panels can be disassembled with your fingers. There are lots of places to mount radiators or fans (even the perforated surfaces intended for ventilation). Just a great case overall.
customer_reviews.author: Ian C.

customer_reviews.title: Only four star this is why.
customer_reviews.text: This has no drive bays I'm an old timer still like to have drive bays 2 fans would of been enough but it's sturdy and great quality love thermal take that's all I use but I like my old thermal take pc case with 3 bays you don't need three bay but at least one would of been nice that's why this pc case get's only 4 stars other then that it's great thermal take quality pc case look amazing clear side panel looks awesome RGB looks fun. But would not recommend if your not a gamer. Try other thermal take pc cases.
customer_reviews.author: pedro j

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, even for big hands.
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of fun with this build (mostly). Everything comes apart, the placement combinations seem endless. Swapping MB's was super easy as you could get at it from any angle. Asrock x570m pro 4 mATX (first one bad NIC, no issues on second) Ryzen 5 3400G Corsair Vengence LPX 2x8gb 3600Mhz 2 Sabrent Rocket NVMe 4.0 SSD Corsair H100i RGB Platinum SE Corsair CX 650M Noctua fans Used for internet browsing/sweepstaking. Cons: Where are all the x570 mATX Boards?
customer_reviews.author: Tierney

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous, sleek with great options!
customer_reviews.text: I'm absolutely in love with this sleek case. Metal frame. Tempered glass side cover. The glass is slightly tinted which looks great! Plenty of fan and liquid cooler attachments. Works great with Mystic Light. The lighting effects for the fans are gorgeous. If you want you can connect them directly to your board and use RGB, Mystic Light, etc. to control them, but you lose some of the effects from the case controller board by doing that.
customer_reviews.author: James Burke

customer_reviews.title: Modularly awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love this case. Works great for my build: Case: Thermaltake Core v21 Motherboard: GigaByte GA-B150M-D3H Processor: Intel i5 6600 @ 3.30GHz RAM: 16GB HyperX Fury Graphics: 8GB Gigabtye GTX 1070 Storage: - 256GB Toshiba SSD - 2TB Toshiba HDD - 1TB Hitachi Touro S USB HDD Cooling: - Cooler Master Hyper 212EVO - Corsair Air Series Blue LED Fan x2 - Corsair Air Series Purple LED Fan x2 Power Supply: EVGA 550 G2
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice for closed loop liquid cooling solutions.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice case that will take a full size PSU and has some good features like the side mounted drives. However, the biggest issue with the case are the claims of supporting smaller water cooling solutions without ever showing any real means of mounting the radiator. I attempted to install a Corsair H60 in the unit and there was no position in which the mounting wouldn’t stress the hoses. If they had built the top with a radiator in mind it would have been perfect, but instead it is a wasted opportunity.
customer_reviews.author: Gaiking

customer_reviews.title: This case is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Instantly dropped my internal temps by almost 10 degrees, not to mention it fits almost anywhere in my living room. I currently have it hooked up to my tv as a gaming/htpc. It looks like a subwoofer so people don't really notice it as being out of the ordinary. I was also able to fit a deepcool gammaxx 153mm high after market air cooler for my cpu as well as a reference amd rx 580 GPU. The fact that this case can be configured and customize to fit almost any pc solution is a win for me. I will definitely purchase this case again for future builds!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case. Here are three reasons why: 1. The quality is over the asking price. The case is relatively inexpensive, but it is sturdy and we'll made, and designed well. 2. The extra room for the small case made my build a snap, cable management really basic, and easy to adjust. Two sides and the top come off with thumb skrews. Everything goes in easy. 3. It feels really solid. I move my itx cases. I don't like them to feel flimsy. This one, on the cheap, feel really robust. I don't worry for instance when I drive with it it in my car. Good product at a good price
customer_reviews.author: That one guy

customer_reviews.title: Nice Desktop Cube
customer_reviews.text: The mini-ITX cube is a good size to sit on a desktop or shelf. The plexiglass top makes it easy to see inside, so you may want to tie up cables a little nicer than a closed case. The cube is a little large for mini-itx boards and enables the use of a standard sized atx power supply. There are two side mounts for solid state drives and plenty of space above the motherboard for fairly large CPU fan/heatsink. The case provides a USB 3 connection cable for the front panel area. If your board only has a USB 2 connector available, you will need a 19 pin USB 3 (female) to 9 pin USB 2 (male) adapter cable.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Fine case, but a little disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: The case looks as fine as it does in many pictures but there's some things that felt really disappointing. The side glass panel is a four point screw panel which makes maintenance or minor tweaks a nightmare. The right side has a very tight space making it prone to cable bulging if you aren't careful with how you manage in the back. And worst of all, the PCI-E slot covers are break which severely downgrades the feel of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Chase

customer_reviews.title: For the price there isn't much better out there.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice case for a good price. Not a ton a features but if you're looking for a case with good ventilation and a more unique form factor than your standard tower, this is a hard deal to pass up. Originally I got the Core V1 which I didn't realize was a mini ITX case but my mobo was micro atx. The reason I'm knocking off a star isn't because of my mistake; this case is a tad bigger than I realized. This is a desktop that sits on the floor so the overall size isn't a huge issue. Overall I'm happy with this case and my build.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Pass on this one
customer_reviews.text: Not a great case to work in, I went budget and I regret it. My old Rosewell was much better and cheaper. The back plates make you wonder if anyone at Thermaltake has ever actually built a PC. The are tough to work with and to get access to the HDMI port I actually had to bend the metal even after removing the plates. Thankfully it’s on the back so no one will see but I recommend even budget PC builders look elsewhere. Thermaltake prioritized pretty lights over practicality. Manual could be much better as well.
customer_reviews.author: Fable Fan

customer_reviews.title: Junk is junk
customer_reviews.text: This was ,as plainly as I can put it, a G..D... piece of junk. The documentation was non-existent to laughable, there was no provision for installing peripheral drive modules, or even adequately and/or easily installing 3.5 hard drives. There was no provision for board connected controls, etc etc etc. The lighting was beautiful, any 10 year old kid would be really impressed. I feel imposed upon by your even asking what my opinion of this product is, I'm sure that there are competent people, probably not near main stream management in you corporate hierarchy who would agree with me, but either cannot voice their opinions, or are just rolled over in management incompetence. What a sorry product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good case
customer_reviews.text: There are two features that I like right off the bat: the first is the RGB fans in the front of the case and the second is the RGB controller - both are already installed and ready to go. The cable management is well planned out and despite is smaller size everything that I need/want for my system build fits. I am running a 1070ti plus a Cooler Master MA610P without any size issues. I will soon be purchasing one more for my upcoming project.
customer_reviews.author: Vince_A

customer_reviews.title: This is a really large PC case and well built
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded the PC with this new case to handle a larger water cooler for the processor. Plenty of room and well structured. I really like the screen type dust filters that are easily removed and cleaned. Each time the PC starts or comes out of sleep the 3 included fans (with blue LEDs you can turn off) are set to high. I manually change to low and have not tried to see if I can change it. Not really a negative.
customer_reviews.author: RickP

customer_reviews.title: EASIEST CASE I HAVE EVER BUILT IN!
customer_reviews.text: I have built something like 10 computers from scratch (and taken apart and rebuilt some of my old ones more than I can count) This was the EASIEST case I have ever built. It is small. It is clean looking (may build 1-2 for myself for home theatre and/or streaming machine) STRONGLY recommend this for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Station2Station

customer_reviews.title: After owning this for a while I can say it works excellent, negative reviews are wrong
customer_reviews.text: I can not imagine ever using another case besides this, It is so easy to work with and I put the glass panel on the top so I can look down and see everything lit up inside. This is the jewel of my living room, it looks nice sitting under my 4K TV, has great airflow, I don't know what some of these reviews are talking about, they probably did not add extra exhaust fan, as you can see I got the 120mm Thermal take blue led for the rear and thats all i need, sides and bottom are vented. It has been a pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kuhlman

customer_reviews.title: My Dream Case
customer_reviews.text: This case is a beauty, with tempered glass side, and 3 LED multicolored fans already installed. The glass shows off my AMD Prism cooler beautifully. Case is extremely well built, very solid, and well thought out. The only down side was that installing a mechanical hard drive required taking off the front cover. But hey, you don't install those very often anymore, and the ease of the SSD installs makes up for up. She's a beauty :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite Case
customer_reviews.text: I love this little case it has great airflow and the side panels are all swap-able so you can set it up to your needs. I fit a massive Noctua NH D15 cooler and a Strix GTX 1070 GPU in with no problems. The parts are close together but the orientation assures proper air flow and temperatures. I like to be able to take my PC with me when I need to and this small case allows for that. My only complaint is that the motherboard screw holes were not all drilled out and threaded properly causing some mounting screws to feel a bit loose.
customer_reviews.author: Ben S.

customer_reviews.title: The best mini ITX case I have found
customer_reviews.text: The best mini ITX case I have found. White makes it so much easier to deal with as well. Superb design, the 200mm front fan moves enough air to cool any set-up except high overclocking. The cpu fan can be of normal size, the case excepts full-size graphics cards thanks to the ingenious slot made in the front panel to handle the excess length. You can fit 4 HHD’s internally and full-sized power supplies. I built a screaming gamer box with this case, as there are several good mini ITC MB’s today. There is no need for huge tower cases anymore when building a gaming PC (or a multi-media workstation). A great case for $75+, for $48, a steal...
customer_reviews.author: Waikiki

customer_reviews.title: Great Case, beautiful tempered glass
customer_reviews.text: Amazing looking case, airflow might be a little bad, one thing to take note is that when removing brackets for the graphics card, it was really hard, I had to bend that thing so many times. If you took it off the wrong way, you might scratch the motherboard. The tinted tempered glass looks amazing, crystal clear. The rgb is great, I don’t like how the front kind of exposes the back cables. Other than that great case
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

customer_reviews.title: Great value and attractive case
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great value Attractive case Great build quality (on almost everything) Cons: Flimsy drive caddies Not the greatest cable management This case has fantastic airflow and value for what you get, my only complaint is really with the drive caddies. They are a very flimsy steel and easily bend, but otherwise this case is perfect for ITX builds without sacrificing airflow. The removable side and bottom/top panels make it a breeze to work in. I'd like to see better cable management options in future iterations, as there really isn't any good areas to zip tie or secure cabling.
customer_reviews.author: Semperfio6

customer_reviews.title: works, but really cheap
customer_reviews.text: I honestly thought this would be a better case than it really was. The whole case just screams of cheap corner-cutting costs. there is practically nothing excellent about the case. it does work fine for the money, but I was expecting more for $50. most mid-towers can do better in this price range. airflow is better than some mini-ITX cases i've worked in for sure. the side panel window is really poor. cable management is abysmal. I would go for a different case at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Hollenbeck

customer_reviews.title: Good case with some MINOR FLAWS
customer_reviews.text: First off let my say The cons •that this is not as small of a case as i expected As big as some mid tower cases. •case has acrylic panel instead of tempered glass(scratches easier) •directions aren’t clear especially especially when doing vertical motherboard mount Pros •good airflow comes with fan in front •customizable able to switch panels very easily •dust filters All in all a good case and worth it especially if you want a cube case.But beware that the cons stated above
customer_reviews.author: john DeSpirito

customer_reviews.title: My First ever PC Build
customer_reviews.text: I Really like this case for my first ever PC build, it took me 3 days long to finish putting all the parts together, but this was just wiring issues, Because this case was very easy to deal with, and the manuel was helpful, I only gave this 4 stars istead of 4, is that It does not offer enough SSD towering and it does not come with pre build SSD/HDD towers and the back fan is not LED supported, But for the most part, the price is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Saud

customer_reviews.title: Great Flexible Case
customer_reviews.text: I read up reviews on this case for my first build, and it is pretty beginner friendly. Because all the panels are removable and there is quite a bit of room, it's not too tough for a mini-ITX setup. Having all the panels interchangeable is nice too. I wanted to see the "top-down" window view of the inside from a side angle, and could do this by just switching all the panels around and rotating the case clockwise. The only downside is that this case is not good for cable management, as there aren't any hidden compartments. In case you're wondering, I removed the front panel and grill to paint it. This was a relatively painless mod.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Dickens

customer_reviews.title: Overall nice case, but poor cooling and rear fan DOA
customer_reviews.text: Got this case setup relatively quickly, plenty of space inside for 2 big video cards. Cooling/Fans are definitely the downside to this case. Front fans draw air in from the front right side which is nice, but the RPM's on the fans are not strong enough to to utilize this design. Also, the rear fan did not work out of the box. And now I need to replace all these fans while my PC heats up way too much.
customer_reviews.author: T. Shimizu

customer_reviews.title: Best mATX case by far.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case. The design is very good. You can place your motherboard in a vertical or horizontal position depending on how you orient the case. A horizontal set-up allowed me to keep my GTX1070 from putting pressure on the MB. Lots of room for fans and my DeepCool Captain 240ex fits well. I also kept the window on the top of the case. This hides the cables very well and makes my cable management look much better than it actually is. This might be the best case design of all the micro ATX cases. Very happy with the result.
customer_reviews.author: Ambra Bruce

customer_reviews.title: It looks good but
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared to move the fans in front. The 3 fans installed in front are on the outside of the case which leaves little room for actual air intake. I moved one of the fans to the back top exhaust position and the other two back so they are inside of the case. It’s not as pretty as how it was configured out the box but I have much better airflow and lower temps. My case also came with a small scuff on the acrylic front panel, which I noticed upon finishing my build and peeling the plastic. Aside from those things it’s a really easy case to build in.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Fox

customer_reviews.title: Great and unique PC case
customer_reviews.text: I built a new gaming PC and used this case. I wanted a powerful PC while keeping it smaller. It is very easy to customize (you can switch around the panels) and holds all of my hardware plus a ton of extra room while not taking up a on of space. It appears to be great quality, and there are "filters" on the mesh-like sides to minimize dust from getting into the case. I also have LED lights (my Sapphire Radeon RX 590 and additional fans) which provide a cool "glow" seen from the top and side panels.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K

customer_reviews.title: Had to return because my GPU did not fit, but it was still an awesome case
customer_reviews.text: I have a GTX 980 Strix and it was too long. I wish it wasn't though cause the case was pretty cool. The way all the panels come apart exposing the internal chassis makes it really easy to set up and configure (granted your GPU fits). Would have been really cool. Cannot say much more about it other than to read the specs and make sure that your GPU is not going to be too long to fit in it. I would go for mini versions of GPUs if you want to use this case, although it will fit full size video cards that are not as long as mine (maybe too long by half an inch)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Affordable rgb case
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying that this case is beautiful. It's pretty spacious and easy to build in. The rgb controller came completely assembled so all I had to do was plug the headers in and everything was done. A side note, the front has ample room for a 240-360mm radiator but the top can be a tight squeeze depending on the pastic pieces on your certain mobo. I managed to squeeze my coolermaster ml240 up at the top. Overall, a great budger rgb case!
customer_reviews.author: Tchang

customer_reviews.title: Fine Case
customer_reviews.text: I had heard that this was one of the better "small" cases around but it's really not small at all. I should've looked more closely at the dimensions, because while it is short, it is super wide. But that was my fault for not doing more research. Anyway, it is a perfectly fine case. Basically every side except the one with the glass is covered in a grate so the air flow is very good. Cable management is easy even with a non-modular PSU because there is a ton of space underneath the motherboard. The only tricky part about the build was setting up the PSU brace.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty case with a few flaws
customer_reviews.text: The PCI slot covers require pliers to remove, and it's difficult if not impossible to do this without bending the very thin strips of metal between the slots. It was annoying enough that I was looking up aftermarket slot covers to replace all of the ones I wasn't removing before I even had my video card installed. The front panel is pretty, but a bit hard to remove, which is necessary to install a 3.5 inch drive in the front bays. It's also designed to show off the RBG fans instead of providing air for them to circulate.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Average quality. Low price.
customer_reviews.text: I love this case, especially for the price. The sheet metal seems a little thin, but I think this is what your can expect these days. I remember when solid aluminum was all the rage, and the cases were really excellent in quality. Bought an extra three 140MM fans to finish it out. I'm happy with just white for the fan color. The front panel seems to collect dust, so you may want to grab some canned air to clean things up from time to time. Happy!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Big case for a small board
customer_reviews.text: I used this case for my 1st pc build. I installed m-atx but an itx board would also fit. Using 1 of the 2 smallest standard board in a cube case makes for lots of room under the hood. It comes with a large 200mm front fan and the sides are the same size as the top and bottem so there's lots of ways to configure a custom layout of components. I've got the main board set horizontal and duel gpu's set vertical without any additional support. What's really cool is that you can bolt 2 of these cases together vertically to make a full size tower; great for upgrading
customer_reviews.author: ray peeler

customer_reviews.title: Connect fan hub to SYS FAN port on MB and SATA power to sync lighting.and fan speed.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 4 preinstalled connected a control hub only requires one motherboard fan connections for all 4 fans. Also allows RGB lights to sync with the motherboard. Good ventilation with magnetic dust filter on top and easy access to slide out filters on bottom. Lots of room for tall CPU heatsink and long GPU. Cons: Only one USB 3.0 port No HDD rack. Glass side panel isn't hinged. Included "manual" is pointless especially when it comes to fan hub. Power on LED is blinding. Rear slot panel for expansion cards have to be ripped out with pliers and cannot be replaced..
customer_reviews.author: Nater

customer_reviews.title: Very bad quality
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this case, it very weak constructed. Also doest hold scrues at all. I just wasted my money on it and has to buy a new case.
customer_reviews.author: CACHA

customer_reviews.title: This case is one of the best budget cases
customer_reviews.text: This case is one of the best budget cases... PERIOD. I build many computers a month for clients and I ended up buying this for my own computer at home. There is plenty of space for cable management, Airflow is excellent, Dust filters everywhere, Supports EATX (not officially), Rooms for CD drives multible desktop HDDS and SSD/laptop drives. The window does a excellent job showcasing your computer. This case is now the one I exclusively. My specs: I5-3570k @ 4.6ghz corsair h60 EVGA z77 Classified EATX 20gb RAM 2x Powercolor 390 in crossfire EVGA 850 PSU multiple corsair fans 2x 256 SSDs 1x 1TB HDD 1x 3tb HDD
customer_reviews.author: Dhofmann679

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: not sure why warmth was a factor on the review chart as you never really want a warm computer and this thing is completely open to allow air to come through. AWESOME little box. Currently this is running as a home server with a raid 5 array. The only thing that it was missing was a few extra hard drive slots. Very versatile and easy to rearrange
customer_reviews.author: King Tony

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good value
customer_reviews.text: The case is built in the manner of it's price range. It is rigid enough, but still a little flimsy. I dislike the fact you have to tear out and waste the PCI slot backs, you will cut yourself every single time you do this. The power LED can be seen from orbit. I had to unplug it. Bad choice, I thought we were past ultra bright light blue LEDS to indicate the system is on. Still, the system, runs cool enough in this rig (Ryzen 2600, GTX 1070) . The lights on the RGB fans are pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: Techtesting

customer_reviews.title: Microwave
customer_reviews.text: The headline for my review is a little misleading, but I'm saying that it looks like a microwave. It's such a quirky look and I absolutely love it! There's an included 200mm 3 pin intake fan that's quiet and sucks in a lot of air. I've got that hooked up with 2 80mm pwm fans from Noctua and my PC stays relatively cool. The panels of the case are also interchangeable. If you want a quirky case, definitely consider this.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Great Looking Inexpensive Case
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, I havn't tried to sync the colors through the bios but I am pretty sure you can. Looks pricier than it is plenty of space for a mid size board just if you have any non m.2 hard drives not quite sure where they would go. Seems like they would just be free sliding around the bottom right open area. The MOBO Power cord might have a little trouble through the back panel if you want to run it that way not too much spacing but I did make it fit.
customer_reviews.author: SnoopyCool

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice enough case with decent space for cable management etc. Would be nice to see instruction that shows how to connect a liquid cooler with the existing RGB setup. Also, the rubber washers by the case screws should be glued in. I am guessing they are there to help reduce noise and vibrations but they fell off once I moved the screws to open the case.
customer_reviews.author: Teflon

customer_reviews.title: Good case, a little hot.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Great quality for price. - Fits a decent sized graphics card. - Great radiator support. - Good stock rear fan (replaced the stock one for the added rgb) -Great rgb support, I am able to customize every one of my parts. - Amazing options for cable management - Good psu cover to hide all the wires. Cons: - Not great for a pc that puts out a lot of heat, but it’s not hot enough to cause any problems. - To remove the PCI slot covers you have to break them, this could lead to scratching or bending of the case but can easily be avoided if you are careful.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Seitzinger

customer_reviews.title: Decent case but not enough air flow.
customer_reviews.text: Although the case came with nice RGB lighting the front FANs do not intake enough cool air to help cool the pc parts inside. My CPU and GPU ran at 60c at idle. I had to drill holes in the front acrylic to let more cool air in. I drilled 9 small holes in front of each front fan to let cool air. Now my CPU and GPU temps dropped 15c each at idle and don't go above 65c during load.
customer_reviews.author: pscomplete

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: The case was very nice to build in, and was easy to cable manage. I also appreciate the nice cut outs for larger CPU coolers. The only negative I have for the case is air flow. The front of the case only has cutouts on the very right side and a small hole on the bottom of the front panel, which needless to say do not achieve great air flow. A solution would be to mount the fans on the inside side of the mounting brackets on the front side of the case, but doing this would only allow there to be two fans on the front side.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect case for a beginner build
customer_reviews.text: Used this case to teach my daughter how to build her first computer, used spare parts from another build. The way all the panels are easily removed using thumbscrews makes install a breeze. Came with motherboard and PSU mounting screws, with all panels removed you can access everything from multiple angles. The gaunt 200mm fan up front is whisper quiet and provides more than enough airflow. We even dressed it up a bit with some programmable LEDs. Great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Oz

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Case for SFF Build
customer_reviews.text: The case was excellent in terms of quality and construction. The instructions on the other hand were something entirely different. From the instructions it is difficult to determine which are the proper screws to go with different parts of the case. You are forced to try and discern between screw length and screw head type the proper screws for different things. It would be much easier to stamp a number on the screw head or package the screw for the motherboard and the disk drives in distinct packages identified as to their function.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for the price and good air flow
customer_reviews.text: I love it, the price is good for what it is. Pretty simple to build. Fans are silent. Was afraid of air flow based on some reviews but I actually gained about 10 degree less compared to my other build. 29 degrees Celsius at idle I think is pretty good. My only complaint is no way to chance the speed of the fans and as I pulled off the protective film there was a scratch on the inside of the front cover that is pretty noticeable but after the time of installing everything I’m not going to take it all back apart n do it again over that.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Parts missing! Beware of missing parts!
customer_reviews.text: Update: This case doesn't come with trays as advertised. When I contacted customer service I received no answer. Over all it's a nice case and I like it. But don't expect help from customer service and your case might not have everything that is advertised. HDD 3.5 trays missing and HDD 2.5 screws aren't included. Delaying my build!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Ryzen build
customer_reviews.text: works great for my low power ryzen build, all together it is using a EVGA550 watt fully modular PSU, Thermaltake Core V V21 Case, 500GB NVME Samsung SSD, 16GB ddr4 O.C. to 3000Mhz balistix ram, and stock cooler on a Ryzen 5 2600, and a temporary video card of an EVGA 1050 2GB video card. I love the build, I got a 1070FE used coming to sweeten the System as well and help me game at 4k on windows 10(not max graphics but pretty darn good) Side panels are a little warbly on their own but I really like the case.
customer_reviews.author: reppdog

customer_reviews.title: Great case but only one small issue...
customer_reviews.text: Cable management. 4 star for this. Unfortunately there really isn't many places to attach zip ties to to allow for very clean cable management. That being said, this case's build quality is amazing. Is extremely rigid. I could drop it and not worry about it or components inside. Also wish side panel was tempered glass instead of a plastic window. Plenty of air flow and components inside stay nice and cool as intended. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Austin W.

customer_reviews.title: Great case, but the manual sucks
customer_reviews.text: I love this case! It's somewhat simple to build in, looks super cool, and airflow is good. It comes with a big fan in the front, and I put one in the back, and one on top. I really like how you can see your GPU. Cable management actually wasn't too difficult, but it would be nice if it had more places the cables could come from. The only reason it is not 5 stars is the manual. The instructions aren't very good. I had to lookup a video on the power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas B.

customer_reviews.title: Decent case for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good small form factor case. It was pretty easy to assemble the new computer using this case. The only con in my case was that I didn't look closely enough to catch that there was no provision for an internal DVD drive, but it is still a great little case. Build quality appears to be quite good. And it is easy to pull the sides, top and bottom off to get access to the internals. Would likely buy again if I needed a similar case without an internal DVD drive.
customer_reviews.author: BurtB

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tower for my new PC build, and when I got all the parts into it, and went to turn it on the power buttons did not work!!! We checked to make sure it was not the power supply or anything else. We checked for error codes, and the only thing that had an issue was the dang power buttons on the front of the tower!! This resulted in my boyfriend having to go out and buy a new tower.
customer_reviews.author: kristen beck

customer_reviews.title: Well-made case
customer_reviews.text: Great case to build in. If you plan cable management out ahead of time, it can really turn out great. I was able to fit a 120mm Corsair AIO cooler for the CPU in there and the GPU pulls air right in from the outside of the case so no need to watercool GPU at this time. Paired it with a Thermaltake Riing Trio 200mm front fan and we're off to the races!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fans Do Not Work
customer_reviews.text: I've had this case for two years and the fan controller hasn't worked in over a year! I've finally made my last attempt to contact Thermaltake to get a replacement, and they simply do not respond. Their customer service is terrible and the case itself would be great if the fans worked. I write this review because two of my friends bought the same case and have the same issue. It is also a very common issue when looking at reviews on other sites.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great design. Horrible quality.
customer_reviews.text: Dear Thermaltake, Please make a high-quality version of this case. The design and modularity of this case is wonderful but the machining is garbage. I have to crank the screws so hard to get them to go in and the frame is warped. The front panel audio jack also broke within days. So why in my right mind did I buy (and will be keeping) this? Case-modding. It was one of very few cases that fit my requirements. The inside is now a lovely white.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Castellanos

customer_reviews.title: Great case, fits the EVGA RTX 3090 Ultra FTW3
customer_reviews.text: Great case, fits the EVGA RTX 3090 Ultra FTW3 just fine with room to spare. The front 200mm fan is very quiet, but can be upgraded to a Noctua 200mm as well for an even further noise reduction. Very easy to assemble, I'm impressed with how modular every part is. Highly recommended case!
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Case! For the Price!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome looking tower for the price. Most rgb fans sets are around $30 . But this case comes with 3 rgb fans and one black exhaust fan for the back with the price. They say it’s a mid atx tower but looks larger in person. I think the case is great. Only one thing since I got two of them one case didn’t come with the screws to mount the motherboard. But all was resolved by Amazon tech Amit who issued me a $10 credit so I can order a small box of pc crews.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: The best case I have ever worked with
customer_reviews.text: This is so much case in such a little space. If you want to keep things small, but still have space for plenty of power, this is the best choice. Pros: -Small, but spacious! -All the sides come off really easily, makes for a simple assembly. -Fits a really large video card -Air flow through the case is great, just make sure to put a vented panel in front of your video card. -Looks awesome. Cons: -The hard drive trays are a little finicky, but they serve their purpose well
customer_reviews.author: Alex W.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Both cases broken upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible experience. Bought this as a birthday present only to find that the wires were broken and the date to return had expired by the time it was the birthday. So i ordered a completely new one and now this one has only two lights working on the front when it’s supposed to be three lights.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product, unable to get a response from manufacturer, and no support from Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Product is defective and I can not get any help resolving problem. It was purchased for a gift and not used for 4 months. Amazon shows return window and support window no longer open. Manufacture apparently doesn't have a phone number and only contact is via website and a 7 day wait. I have tried them twice but no reply. Probably a simple solution if I could reach someone.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Hill

customer_reviews.title: Great little case for system builders
customer_reviews.text: It was a little larger than expected but i still like it. I built a Mini ITX board into it. All sides come off including the top making is super easy to build. Plenty of ventilation and room for full sized video cards. A regular ATX motherboard will NOT fit into this case, it is not supposed to just making that clear. Mini ITX fits nicely. Would i buy this case again? yes i would.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Best investment ever.
customer_reviews.text: First time pc builder! Thermaltake has a new #1 fan! I replaced the case fan with a thermaltake rgb fan. Also used the dual flo thermaltake rgb cooler. All work perefectly!!!! Love the orginal fans that come on the front. I have them set to breath through all the different colors when I don’t have it set for purple. There’s plenty of space with this case. Can’t go wrong with thermaltake.
customer_reviews.author: Ti

customer_reviews.title: Can't do better for the price.
customer_reviews.text: The case is not perfect. The metal is somewhat thin and certain riveted parts are loose. There are quirky design choices such as the snap-on PCI slot cover and lack of a fine filter cover for the base. The power/reset buttons feel cheap. The HDD drive bays are difficult to access once everything is together. But, wow! For $60? I can't imagine this case being any better. It's a modder's paradise with options galore. Every panel comes off including the base. It's about as free-form as it gets.
customer_reviews.author: K. Stone

customer_reviews.title: Love this case!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the most well laid out cases I've ever owned. Compact but still able to hold 4 drives total (2- 2.5 and 2 - 3.5)! I was surprised by the amount of room the case provides in such a small form factor. This is my first ITX build so I was concerned about expandability of storage but 4 hard disk slots are just the right amount for my current hackintosh build. If your looking for a smaller form factor case this ones a winner!
customer_reviews.author: R. Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Easy access, small case, looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! I've gotten past my youth where all I wanted was a huge case to jam lots of crap in it. I'm done with LED lighting, fan controllers, hot swapping drive bays, dozens of fans. Just wanted a small case with easy access. This case is perfect for that. Might be a little louder since there's lots of venting holes all over, but it's the best case I've ever owned. No problems fitting a large graphics card. Using an AIO water cooler on the CPU and the radiator fan is the only one in the case. Stays cool and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great case!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for my wife's mini ITX build and we both love the look of it. I had some issues with the HHD/SSD brackets like most people have, but not a huge issue. The graphics card I put in was MSI Armor 8GB Radion RX 580... and some how I fit it in even though its a pretty large card. It extends past the frame towards the main fan and I had to pre attach my VGA cord to have it fit because it was right where the frame was. Either way I am super happy with this case!
customer_reviews.author: Justice

product_meta.title: Thermaltake Core V1 Snow Edition SPCC Mini ITX Cube Computer Chassis CA-1B8-00S6WN-01, White
product_meta.description:
THERMALTAKE CORE V1 SNOW EDITION SPCC MINI ITX CUBE COMPUTER CHASSIS CA-1B8-00S6WN-01


Product Description:

Experience the ease of installation and maximum cooling only Thermaltake can deliver with the Core V1 Snow Mini ITX Cube Chassis. With multiple configurations for both Air and Liquid cooling setups, the Core V1 offers multiple options for today’s cooling demands. Save time with a tool-free drive bay design, optimized air flow and modular chassis options to configure your build, your way and get back to gaming



Key Features:

 * Mini ITX Cube Chassis
 * Material: SPCC
 * Motherboard Compatibility: Mini ITX (6.7” x 6.7”)
 * 200mm Black Front Fan Pre-installed
 * Side Panels: Window (Interchangeable)
 * 3 Year Warranty



Expansion:

 * 2 x 3.5”
 * 2 x 2.5”
 * Expansion Slots: 2



Side Panel I/O Ports:

 * USB 3.0 x 2
 * HD Audio x 1



Fan Support:

 * Front: 1 x 120mm / 1 x 140mm / 1 x 200mm
 * Rear: 2 x 80mm



Radiator Support: 

 * Front: 1 x 120mm or 1 x 140mm



Dimension & Weight:

 * 10.9” x 10.2” x 12.4” (H x W x D)
 * 10.4 lb



Clearance:

 * Max CPU Cooler Height: 140mm
 * Max VGA Length: 255mm (Inner chassis) / 285mm (Outer chassis)
 * Max PSU Length: 200mm



Support
Please visit our website or search "Thermaltake Support" for any assistance.
feature_bullets: Chambers Concept (Dual Modular Rack Design): the upper chamber is made for cooling performance and efficiency, and the lower chamber is made for power supply and cable management

Extreme Air/Liquid Cooling Configurations Options: With the removable 2.5 inches/3.5 inches drive device racks, users can gain max interior space for advance cooling performance or liquid system build

Advanced Ventilation: Core V1 Snow has various mounting points to supports all types of cooling systems that includes DIY/AIO liquid cooling systems and air cooling units + 1 x 200 mm Fan reinstalled in the front + 2 x 80 mm turbo fans at the rear

Interchangeable Side Panel: Symmetrical panels allow users to build the system with personality. A removable PSU dust filter and adjustable shockproof rubbers is built with the bottom panel of the chassis to prolong the PSU usage
Handy I/O Ports: Design with convenience and cleanness in mind, Core V1 Snow has built in dual USB 3.0 and HD audio connectors together with the Power and Reset Button on the side of front panel

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars361 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
